definition: yes (used by Emperor or ruler)/OK/to accede/to assent
to take a picture of a person without permission or without their knowledge
illegal immigration/to stowaway (on a ship)/to steal across the international border/to run a blockade
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to peep/to peek/to act as voyeur
to skimp on the job and stint on materials (idiom)/jerry-building/sloppy work
to carry on a clandestine love affair
to peep/to peek/to steal a glance

sentences.english: The cunning thief stole the money out of the man's pocket.
sentences.chinese: 狡滑的小偷從那位男士的口袋裏偷了錢。

sentences.english: Boy stole a lesson-book from one of his school-fellows and took it home to his Mother.
sentences.chinese: 有個男孩偷了同學的一本教科書，帶回家給母親。

sentences.english: The old man dared him to steal the bike.
sentences.chinese: 那老頭調唆他去偷那輛自行車。

sentences.english: She's really an old hand to hop the plane.
sentences.chinese: 她可真是一個偷乘飛機的老手了。

sentences.english: Yeah, we need to steal a time machine.
sentences.chinese: 那就是啦，我們要去偷時空穿梭機。

sentences.english: Her wallet stolen, she had no money to buy even a bus ticket.
sentences.chinese: 因爲錢包被偷了，她甚至連買車票的錢也沒有了。

sentences.english: Sunspear stayed loyal to my father when the Usurper stole his throne.
sentences.chinese: 太陽矛在篡權者偷了我父親的皇冠後一直對他忠誠。

sentences.english: Stupid! He's stolen food and hit the road! What did I expect?
sentences.chinese: 我真笨，它一定偷食物後落跑我還期望它會怎樣？

sentences.english: After robbing the till for months the cashier was found out.
sentences.chinese: 那出納員從錢櫃裏偷錢偷了好幾個月後才被發現。

sentences.english: Jakob thinks that Adrienne doesn’t know I stole the jewels.
sentences.chinese: 雅克布認爲阿德里安娜不知道我偷了珠寶。

sentences.english: My bag was stolen, and my passport was in it.
sentences.chinese: 我的包被偷了，護照還在裏面呢。

sentences.english: Only when he was pick-pocketed on a crowded bus one day did he see the light .
sentences.chinese: 在公共汽車上被偷了錢包，才明白其中的道理。

sentences.english: The man abstracted a pen from my pocket.
sentences.chinese: 那人從我口袋裏偷去了一支筆。

sentences.english: But, did the Knave steal the tarts?
sentences.chinese: 但是，傑克到底有沒有偷餡餅？

sentences.english: In Europe the most pilfered grocery item is luxury cooked meat.
sentences.chinese: 在歐洲，最經常被偷的雜貨店商品是奢侈的熟肉製品。

sentences.english: When he came in, he found a thief stealing his money.
sentences.chinese: 他進來的時候，他發現一個小偷天在偷他的錢。

definition: lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to eat on the sly/to pilfer food/to be unfaithful
to snatch (esp related to a robbery)
to steal (including identity theft, credit card fraud or theft of computer account)/to misappropriate
to peep/to peek/to steal a glance
to lose by theft/to have one's property stolen
